case.summary: Application by accused for exclusion of breathalyzer results on ground that samples were not taken forthwith and that accused's Charter rights were breached -- At time of arrest, police were concerned that accused was prohibited from driving and that accused's insurance had expired -- Police had to tow vehicle -- Accused failed roadside screening test -- HELD: Application dismissed -- Delay was reasonably explained -- Reasonable for officer to give accused detailed account of his rights and his options -- Reasonable explanation for not having done everything as quickly as it otherwise was possible -- Although it was unreasonable for officer to wait with accused at scene until vehicle was towed, no breach of accused's rights took place as tow truck arrived at scene quickly, within 12 minutes -- Total delay was only 22 minutes.
